context: I was too harsh in my criticism
letters:
My dear son,

I hope you can find it in your heart to forgive me. I wanted to take a moment to express how truly sorry I am for the way I spoke to you recently. My criticism was too harsh, and I realize now that it may have hurt you more than I intended. 

I never want to make you feel belittled or discouraged, especially when all you want is to do your best. It pains me to think I may have contributed to any self-doubt you might be feeling. You are an incredible person with immense potential, and I should have supported you with kindness and understanding instead of expressing my frustrations.

Please know that my intentions are always to help you grow and learn, but I understand that my delivery was far from supportive. I value our relationship more than anything, and it breaks my heart to think that I may have put a strain on it.

I promise to work on being more thoughtful and gentle with my words in the future. You deserve a parent who uplifts and encourages you, and I am committed to being that for you.

Thank you for your patience with me, and for being the wonderful person you are. I love you deeply and look forward to making this right.

With all my love,  
[Your Name]

As your parent, my goal is always to support you and help you grow. I understand that my words can carry significant weight, and I failed to communicate my thoughts in a more constructive manner. You deserve encouragement and understanding, especially as you navigate your own challenges.

Please know that I value your feelings and perspective, and I am committed to being more mindful in our discussions moving forward. I appreciate your patience and understanding as I work on being a better listener and a more supportive presence in your life.

Thank you for your understanding, and I look forward to moving past this and continuing to strengthen our relationship.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]
